types

namespace types

Stack

template<typename T> struct Stack

A “stack” class.  Internally it’s a singly linked list of nodes.  Every node has data of type specified by the template argument.

As any stack, it has a top node, pushing onto the stack results in a new top node with data of the last pushed item, popping results in removal of the current top node (that means, previous node will be top again).

It also stores length.

Functions

Stack

Stack(): p_top_node(NULL), p_length(0)

Initializes the Stack.

Stack

~Stack()

Calls pop_back until the length is 0.  That makes sure all the nodes are deleted (and thus memory is not leaked).

length

size_t length() const

Returns the current Stack length.

is_empty

bool is_empty() const

Returns true if the Stack contains no nodes, and false otherwise.

top

T& top()

Returns the data of the top node.

Returns the data of the top node, const version.

Creates a new top node with the data specified by the argument.

pop_back

void pop_back()

Pops out the top node.

clear

void clear()

Calls pop_back until the Stack is empty.
